page.title: 12Haddon Hall
page.content: In 1087 Haddon Hall was owned by William Peverel, whose father was {William the Conqueror.} In 1153 it was passed to the Avenel family. Then in 1170 the Vernon family took it over. It has belonged to their descendants, the Manners family, since 1567. The present owner is the Duke of Rutland who lives at{Belvoir Castle. Today Haddon Hall is open to the public every day during the summer. It is interesting because it is a fine example of a Tudor house, containing pictures, furniture and{tapestries. In addition to the income from the paying public, Haddon Hall is still a profitable farm and receives extra income through the sale of fishing rights on the {River Wye}and shooting rights from the surrounding land.
